Fixes #9934

data.title: `scons` and `scons --help` display a backtrace since new progress indicator
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
All - Godot 2.1 and master branches

**Issue description:**
As mentioned in #9972, since #9553 by @timoschwarzer and the equivalent PR for the 2.1 branch, running `scons` without arguments, or `scons --help`, shows:
```
$ scons
scons: Reading SConscript files ...
No valid target platform selected.
The following were detected:
        android
        javascript
        haiku
        x11
        windows
        server

Please run scons again with argument: platform=<string>
NameError: name 'env' is not defined:
  File "/home/akien/Projects/godot/godot.git/SConstruct", line 464:
    node_count_fname = str(env.Dir('#')) + '/.scons_node_count'
```

The progress indicator logic should not be run if not actually building something.

data.title: ButtonGroup get last pressed button
data.body:
I can't find a way to get the last_pressed_button

ButtonGroup uses set_pressed(false) to unpress a button, this is not sending any signal I can see.

https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/c5ba9d9b7c6d7d2c08d01b13af87748af4dee8a2/scene/gui/base_button.cpp#L47
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/c5ba9d9b7c6d7d2c08d01b13af87748af4dee8a2/scene/gui/base_button.cpp#L327

data.title: The material assigned to a tilemap should take effect unless overwritten by tile material.
data.body:
As it is, assigning materials to tilemaps is extremely counterintuitive. Ideally, it should also be possible to set a tilemap-wide material, as well.

EDIT: This is in 2.1 btw.

data.title: AnimationPlayer not working when testing scene
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10, master branch

**Issue description:**
Want to make moving platform with kinematicBody2D, using AnimationPlayer. While using the editor is normal, but when testing by running the scene, AnimationPlayer is not started. Trying with previous godot build is still working. 

I also trying to using AnimationTreePlayer, result still the same. 

I'm not sure this is real bug, or just me who can't setup it with the new build, test project included.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[Animation.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1187150/Animation.zip)

data.title: Bind some useful methods in SurfaceTool to GDScript
data.body:
These include:
* generate_tangents()
* add_to_format()
* create_from()
* append_from()

Reordered and grouped the bindings to match the header for improved readability.

Removed commented out `generate_flat_normals()` method which wasn't present
in the header.

Fixes #9946

data.title: VisualScript LocalVarSet not holding values when playing scene
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
MacOS 10.12.1 / Godot v3.0.alpha.build.1

**Issue description:**
VisualScripting local vars loose properties on run scene and or when closing and reopening file. 


**Steps to reproduce:**
New project,
Add Node,
Add child Node2D of Node,
Attach VisualScript script to Node2D,
Create '_ready' function,
Add LocalVarSet to _ready,
duplicate LocalVarSet,
set LocalVarSet's to Vector2,
rename LocalVarSet's to 'one' and 'two' respectable,
set LocalVarSet ( "one" ) to Vector2(0,1),
set LocalVarSet ( "two" ) to Vector2(1,0),
Link _ready to the LocalVarSet's in a chain ( _ready -> LocalVarSet ( "one" ) -> LocalVarSet ( "two" )  ),
Press play Scene.

The local vars should now change and have the same value. 

i found this but trying to compare the key presses code ( eg. 'w' -> 87 ) but the numbers would always revert to one of the keys i was trying to compare with. think i had to rewrite the codes a min 6 times before they got stuck and didn't change when i hit the play scene button.


**Link to minimal example project:**
[test.8 - bug reporting VS.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1186931/test.8.-.bug.reporting.VS.zip)

data.title: [2.1] Several Enhancement for "Godot 2 to 3" Exporter

godot 3.0

scons p=windows

core\global_defaults.cpp(1) : fatal error C1083: 无法打开包括文件: “global_conf
ig.h”: No such file or directory

data.title: Rename `_add_child_below_node` to `add_child_below_node`
data.body:
```
extends Control
 
func _ready():
   
    var c0 = Control.new()
    c0.set_name("Control0")
    add_child(c0)
   
    var c1 = Control.new()
    c1.set_name("Control1")
    add_child(c1)
   
    var c2 = Control.new()
    c2.set_name("Control2")
    add_child(c2)
   
    var c3 = Control.new()
    c3.set_name("Control3")
    add_child(c3)
 
func _process(delta):
    set_process(false)
    move_child($Control3,$Control0.get_position_in_parent()+1)
    move_child($Control3,$Control1.get_position_in_parent()+1)#this line is moving Control3 to the last pos but it should be after Control1
   
    for n in get_children():#This also print wrong order remove line 22 and see
        print(n.get_position_in_parent())
```
As a workaround I use this

```
remove_child(c3)
_add_child_below_node($Control1,c3)
```

Can we rename `_add_child_below_node` to `add_child_below_node` ?

data.title: Moved member variables from constructor to initialization list
data.body:
This pull request yields a small performance boost and mitigates the following `cppcheck` messages:

```
[core/object.h:148]: (performance) Variable 'name' is assigned in constructor body. Consider performing initialization in initialization list.

[scene/3d/navigation.h:62]: (performance) Variable 'a' is assigned in constructor body. Consider performing initialization in initialization list.
[scene/3d/navigation.h:63]: (performance) Variable 'b' is assigned in constructor body. Consider performing initialization in initialization list.
[thirdparty/b2d_convexdecomp/b2Polygon.cpp:1478]: (performance) Variable 'position' is assigned in constructor body. Consider performing initialization in initialization list.
[thirdparty/etc2comp/EtcBlock4x4Encoding_ETC1.cpp:79]: (performance) Variable 'm_frgbaColor1' is assigned in constructor body. Consider performing initialization in initialization list.
```


Update: It was decided to not mitigate the following `cppcheck` messages due to a trade-off between readability and performance.
```
[core/math/plane.h:104]: (performance) Variable 'normal' is assigned in constructor body. Consider performing initialization in initialization list.
[core/math/plane.h:110]: (performance) Variable 'normal' is assigned in constructor body. Consider performing initialization in initialization list.
```

The performance gained is negligible and readability is preferred. For those interested, this `normal` variable can be initialized in the initializer list using the ternary operator:
```cpp
	normal((p_dir == CLOCKWISE) ? (p_point1 - p_point3).cross(p_point1 - p_point2) : (p_point1 - p_point2).cross(p_point1 - p_point3))
```

data.title: Fix the documentation (saving games) for godot 3
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 14.04 Godot 3.0 alpha

i'm not sure if that is specific of godot 3, i was following this tutorial:
http://docs.godotengine.org/en/stable/learning/features/misc/saving_games.html
http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/learning/features/misc/saving_games.html
and got this error
Invalid call. Nonexistent function 'to_json' in base 'Dictionary'.
i took me a while to figure out that insted of:

  savegame.store_line(nodedata.to_json())
i should do that:
savegame.store_line(to_json(nodedata))

data.title: Implement 32 bit IEEE float WAVE format
data.body:
It's internally converted to PCM16 format but it reads fine now.
I've also optimized the loops by checking for the format_bits before.

data.title: Animating a skeleton that has a BoneAttachment node will crash the editor.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 64bit - Godot 3.0 Alpha 1

**Issue description:**
If you add a BoneAttachment node to a skeleton and then animate the skeleton in the editor with the AnimationPlayer or the AnimationTreePlayer, the editor will crash. However it seems like running it in-game does not crash the game.

Edit:
I just changed the AnimationPlayer and AnimationTreePlayer process mode to "fixed", and the editor crashing stopped. After switching the process mode back to "idle" it still doesn't crash. I'm not sure if this was just a problem with this demo then.

After deleting the BoneAttachment and adding it again the editor crashing started again. Looks like maybe the BoneAttachment only crashes after it's added for the first time, or something.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open the 3D Platformer demo, open the Player scene, add a BoneAttachment to the skeleton, and try to animate the player. The editor will crash. But if you run the game, the game will not crash.

data.title: Control Node sends wrong events
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
(Android KitKat, arm) Godot 2.1.3 / Godot 2.1.4.official.beta

**Issue description:**
On Android control nodes interpret screen touches as MOUSE_BUTTON and MOUSE_MOTION events instead of SCREEN_TOUCH.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a simple scene with Control Node (checked with Label as well, probably should work for any node inherited from Control)
2. Attach a script
3. Connect the input_event signal
4. Fill in the test method body:
```
func _on_Control_input_event(event):
	print(str('Event type: ', event.type, ' is ', '' if event.is_pressed() else 'not', ' pressed'))
	if event.type == InputEvent.SCREEN_TOUCH and event.is_pressed():
		print('Screen touch!')
```

**Expected result:**
When you touch the Control area on a mobile device
 The output is:
```
Event type: 6 is pressed
Screen touch!
Event type: 6 is not pressed
```

**Actual result:**
When you touch the Control area on a mobile device
 The output is:
```
Event type: 3 is pressed
Event type: 2 is not pressed
Event type: 2 is not pressed
Event type: 2 is not pressed
Event type: 2 is not pressed
Event type: 3 is not pressed
```

For quick reference:
MOUSE_MOTION = 2
MOUSE_BUTTON = 3
SCREEN_TOUCH = 6

data.title: [NativeScript] fix signals from base class not being accessible
data.body: https://github.com/GodotNativeTools/cpp_bindings/issues/26

data.title: Problem with non-triplanar UV2 in SpatialMaterial
data.body:
*Bugsquad edit:* Windows, Godot 3.0-alpha1

There seems to be a problem with the shader that is generated when a SpatialMaterial uses non-triplanar UV2 (the following message: ":24 - Invalid arguments to operator '*' :vec2 and vec3"). The following seems to fix the problem (scene/resources/material.cpp, ine 510): [uv2problem.diff.txt](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1185558/uv2problem.diff.txt).
Only tested under Windows, but I guess it applies to other platforms.

data.title: Can't create new Image in 3.0?
data.body:
Using Godot_v2.1.4-beta_20170625_win64 on Windows 10, I could use the code below to create a new image and set it as the texture of a sprite (with _RGBA instead of _RGBA8).
In Godot_v3.0-alpha_win64, I get the following error message on line 4

Invalid call. Nonexistent function 'Image' in base 'Sprite (sprite.gd)'.

```
extends Sprite
var img
func _ready():
	img = Image(256, 256, false, Image.FORMAT_RGBA8)
	for i in range(0, 256):
		for j in range(0, 256):
			var r = i / 255.0
			var g = j / 255.0
			var b = (i + j) / 255.0
			img.put_pixel(i, j, Color(r, g, b, 1))
	var tex = ImageTexture.new()
	tex.create_from_image(img)
	set_texture(tex)
	pass
```

data.title: Rendering issues with intel HD5500 (config.rgtc_supported == false)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10
Intel HD Graphics 5500
Using the 3.0 alpha
Driver version 20.19.15.4549

**Issue description:**

There are some rendering issues with the new rendered

Rendering issues in supposed to be compatible device, has im not a rendering savy guy would like to help get more info, just need more guidance on how to debug the problem

Examples:
The cheesse looks terrible
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5624658/28746542-b8d6764a-745c-11e7-819e-3eec448843ac.png)

The same error is visible in the bricks and the rocks

```
   At: drivers\gles3\rasterizer_scene_gles3.cpp:145

```

**Steps to reproduce:**
Run the material tester demo


** Note **
If u can help me debug a bit more would gladly provide more information

data.title: No way to add an item to 'tools button' (EditorPlugin.add_tool_menu_item)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
b276d92c8a63887df011032bc95d98bbb9c51c70

**Issue description:**
It seems since 0aa7242624fcd74eaf13db006274829c284fab3b logic to do this task is non existent.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Download Godot sources.
2. Open EditorPlugin.cpp 
3. Check bindings near 400 line, 
4. See that `add_tool_menu_item` and `remove_tool_menu_item` bindings are commented, try to find their logic.
5. See that `add_tool_submenu_item` has some commented logic, and don't seems to do anything.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
